mil3.7.8:0.3: Question on Doing Evil Knowingly or Not Knowingly
mil3.7.8:1.2: “Venerable Nāgasena, for whom is the greater demerit, one who knowingly does evil, or one who does evil unknowingly?”
mil3.7.8:1.3: The elder replied: “Indeed, great king, for him who does evil unknowingly is the greater demerit”.
mil3.7.8:1.4: “In that case, venerable Nāgasena, that one who is our prince or king’s chief minister who unknowingly does evil, we should doubly punish him?”
mil3.7.8:1.5: “What do you think, your majesty, who would get burned more, one who knowingly picks up a hot iron ball, ablaze and glowing, or one who unknowingly picks it up?”
mil3.7.8:1.6: “Indeed, venerable sir, he who unknowingly picks it up would get burned more”.
mil3.7.8:1.7: “Indeed, your majesty, in the same way the greater demerit is for him who does evil unknowingly”.
